title: 185 Celebs Write Letter To Condemn FIR Against 49 Celebs, Say 'More Of Us Will Speak Every Day'
text:
185 Celebs Write Letter To Condemn FIR Against 49 Celebs, Say 'More Of Us Will Speak Every Day'

185 Celebs Write Letter To Condemn FIR Against 49 Celebs, Say 'More Of Us Will Speak Every Day'

In response to the FIR that was filed against 49 celebrities and other prominent personalities who wrote an open letter to Prime Minister Narendra Modi expressing concern over the increasing hate-crimes and cases of lynchings in the nation, about 185 celebrities, literary and cultural personalities condemned the charges.

In a statement they said, “more of us will speak every day”. They also asked whether such harassment by misusing courts was a ploy to slice the voices of citizens.

The 185 signatories include veteran actor Naseeruddin Shah, dancer Mallika Sarabhai, writer Nayantara Sahgal, historian Romila Thapar, singer T.M. Krishna, academic Anand Teltumbde and artist Vivan Sundar among others.

“An FIR has been lodged against forty-nine of our colleagues in the cultural community, simply because they performed their duty as respected members of civil society,” the statement read according to a report on newsclick.in.

“They wrote an open letter to the prime minister, expressing concern about mob lynching in our country. Can this be called an act of sedition? Or is harassment by misusing the courts a ploy to silence citizens’ voices?,” it read.

Meanwhile, many individuals and political parties including The Communist Party of India (Marxist) and the Kerala State Chalachitra Academy among others have also condemned the move.

The FIR was registered in Muzaffarpur district under Indian Penal Code (IPC) sections relating to sedition, hurting religious feelings, insulting with intent to provoke breach of peace and public nuisance.
